briefTitle: FluSAFE: Flu SMS Alerts to Freeze Exposure
officialTitle: FluSAFE: Flu SMS Alerts to Freeze Exposure

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* â‰¥3 persons per household
* At least one person who is less than 18 years old
* English or Spanish speaking
* Household reporter has cell phone with text messaging capabilities
* Household reporter willing to use text messages to report
* Reside within study neighborhoods in New York City

Exclusion Criteria

* Intention to move away from New York City area in \<12 months
* Language other than English or Spanish

primary.description: One self-swab of the index case and self-swabs of other household members will be analyzed using reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) to identify household transmission of laboratory-confirmed influenza.

secondary.measure: Number of Cases of Household Members Meeting Symptomatic Criteria for ILI/ARI
secondary.description: The CDC-provided case definition for ARI is presence of at least two of the following: 1) rhinorrhea/nasal congestion; 2) sore throat; 3) cough; 4) fever/feverishness; 5) myalgia. The ILI definition is at least two of the following signs and symptoms: fever, cough, headache, sore throat, or myalgia.

secondary.measure: Number of Infections of Non-influenza Respiratory Viruses
secondary.description: This outcome will measure household transmission of non-influenza respiratory viruses. One self-swab of the index case and self-swabs of other household members will be analyzed using RT-PCR to identify household transmission of non-influenza respiratory viruses
